company.name: TALX Corporation
company.business_description: TALX is a for-profit corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of Equifax Inc. Since at least 2002, TALX has sold income and employment history information about consumers to lenders, pre-employment screeners, social service agencies, and others. These entities use the information in determining consumers' eligibility for credit, employment, government benefits, or other purposes.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

complaint.factual_background: TALX Corporation, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Equifax Inc. based in St. Louis, Missouri, has operated since at least 2002 as a consumer reporting agency selling income and employment history reports to lenders, pre-employment screeners, social service agencies, and others. As a nationwide specialty consumer reporting agency under the FCRA, TALX was required to provide mandatory notices to both furnishers of information and users of consumer reports. Prior to 2006, TALX failed entirely to provide the required 'Notice To Furnishers of Information' to data furnishers and the 'Notice To Users of Consumer Reports' to report users, in knowing violation of Section 607(d) of the FCRA. The United States brought this action seeking civil penalties and a permanent injunction for TALX's pattern and practice of FCRA violations.

representations_made.description: TALX provided employment and income history reports to third parties, functioning as a consumer reporting agency and nationwide specialty consumer reporting agency under the FCRA, assembling consumer data on a nationwide basis — yet failed to provide the legally required Furnisher Notices and User Notices prior to 2006
representations_made.quoted_text: II. Prior to 2006, T ALX failed to provide Furnisher Notices to furnishers or User Notices to users.

counts.title: Violations of Section 607(d) of the FCRA — Failure to Provide Required Notices
counts.representation: TALX, as a consumer reporting agency, was required under Section 607(d)(1) of the FCRA to provide a 'Notice To Furnishers of Information' to entities that regularly furnish consumer information, and under Section 607(d)(2) to provide a 'Notice To Users of Consumer Reports' to entities receiving consumer reports.
counts.fact: Prior to 2006, TALX failed to provide Furnisher Notices to furnishers or User Notices to users, in violation of Section 607(d) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d). These violations were knowing and constituted a pattern or practice of violations.
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described, TALX violated Section 607(d) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d), and pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

definitions.Defendant: TALX, its subsidiaries and operating companies, and their successors and assigns, officers, agents, representatives, and employees.
definitions.FCRA definitions: The definitions set forth in the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681a, et seq., shall apply.
definitions.Clear and prominent: In an electronic medium the disclosure shall be: (a) unavoidable; (b) of a size and shade, and shall appear on the screen for a duration, sufficient for an ordinary consumer to read and comprehend it; (c) easily printable; and (d) presented on the principal screen or landing page where the disclosure is relevant.
definitions.Employment history: Verifications of employment or income that are created by searching more than one employer-client file.
definitions.Income history: Verifications of employment or income that are created by searching more than one employer-client file.

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $350,000 to the United States Treasury within seven business days of service of the Order.

requirements.description: Pay civil penalty of $350,000 to the Treasurer of the United States by electronic fund transfer
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Defendant shall pay to Plaintiff, pursuant to section 621(a) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a), a civil penalty in the amount of three hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($350,000). A. Defendant shall make this payment within seven (7) business days of the date of service of this Order to the Treasurer of the United States by electronic fund transfer in accordance with instructions provided by the Office of Consumer Litigation, Civil Division, U.S. Department ofJustice, Washington, D.C. 20530, for appropriate disposition.

requirements.description: In the event of default continuing for ten days beyond the due date, the entire unpaid penalty plus interest becomes immediately due and payable
requirements.quoted_text: B. In the event of any defanlt in payment, which default continues for ten (10) days beyond the due date of payment, the entire unpaid penalty, together with interest, as computed pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1961 from the date of default to the date ofpayment, shall immediately become due and payable.

requirements.description: Judgment is a civil penalty owed to the U.S. Government, not subject to discharge under Bankruptcy Code; facts in Complaint shall be taken as true in any subsequent collection litigation
requirements.quoted_text: C. This judgment represents a civil penalty owed to the United States Government and is not compensation for actual pecuniary loss, and, therefore, it is not subject to discharge under the Bankruptcy Code pursuant to II U.S.C. § 523(a)(7). Defendant agrees that the facts as alleged in the Complaint filed in this action shall be taken as true, without further proof, in any subsequent litigation filed by or on behalf of the Commission to collect any unpaid amount or otherwise enforce its rights pursuant to this Order.

requirements.description: Penalty proceedings are in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other civil or criminal penalties provided by law
requirements.quoted_text: D. Proceedings initiated under this Part are in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other civil or criminal penalties that may be provided by law, including any other proceedings Plaintiff may initiate to enforce this Order.

requirements.description: Defendant relinquishes all dominion, control, and title to the funds paid and shall make no claim to or demand return of the funds
requirements.quoted_text: E. Defendant relinquishes all dominion, control, and title to the funds paid to the fullest extent permitted by law. Defendant shall make no claim to or demand return ofthe funds, directly or indirectly, through counselor otherwise.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to provide required FCRA User Notices and Furnisher Notices to all users and furnishers of consumer report information.

requirements.description: Must not fail to provide the FCRA section 607(d) 'User Notice' to all users of Defendant's employment history, income history reports, and any other consumer reports (electronic copy permitted if notice is clear and prominent)
requirements.quoted_text: A. Failing to provide the "User Notice" required by section 607( d) of the FCRA, IS U.S.C. § 168Ie(d), to all users of Defendant's employment history and income history reports and any other consumer reports. Provided, however, that Defendant may provide an electronic copy of this notice to a user if (i) in the ordinary course of business, the user obtains consumer report information from Defendant in electronic form, and (ii) the notice is clear and prominent.

requirements.description: Must not fail to provide the FCRA section 607(d) 'Furnisher Notice' to all furnishers of consumer report information to Defendant (electronic copy permitted if notice is clear and prominent)
requirements.quoted_text: B. Failing to provide the "Fumisher Notice" required by section 607(d) of the . FCRA, IS U.S.C. § l68Ie(d), to all furnishers of consumer report information to Defendant. Provided, however, that Defendant may provide an electronic copy of this notice to a furnisher if (i) in the ordinary cours" of business, the furnisher provides consumer report information to Defendant in electronic form, and (ii) the notice is clear and prominent.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor and investigate Defendant's compliance with the Order, including demanding written reports, documents, depositions, and site access within ten business days of written notice.

requirements.description: Within ten business days of written notice from the Commission, Defendant must submit additional written reports (sworn under penalty of perjury), produce documents for inspection, appear for deposition, and provide entry to business locations during normal business hours
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten business (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, Defendant shall submit additional written reports, which are true and accurate and sworn to under penalty of perjury; produce documents for inspection and copying; appear for deposition; and provide entry during normal business hours to any business location in Defendant's possession or direct or indirect control, to inspect the business operation; provided that, Defendant, after attempting to resolve a dispute without court action and for good cause shown may file a motion with this Court seeking an order including one or more of the protections set forth in Fed. R. Civ. P. 26(c).

requirements.description: Commission is authorized to use all other lawful means including discovery from any person under Fed. R. Civ. P. procedures and posing as consumers or suppliers without prior notice
requirements.quoted_text: B. In addition, the Commission is authorized to use all other lawful means, including but not limited to: 1. obtaining discovery from any person, without further leave ofcourt, using the procedures prescribed by Fed. R. Civ. P. 30, 31, 33, 34, 36, 45, and 69; 2. posing as consumers and suppliers to Defendant, its employees, or any other entity managed or controlled in whole or in party by Defendant, without the necessity of identification or prior notice; and

requirements.description: Defendant must permit Commission representatives to interview any consultant, independent contractor, representative, agent, or employee who has agreed to such an interview; the person interviewed may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: C. Defendant shall permit representatives of the Commission to interview any consultant, independent contractor, representative, agent, or employee who has agreed to such an interview, relating in any way to any conduct subject to this Order. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the Commission of structural changes for five years, submit sworn written compliance reports for three years, notify of any bankruptcy filing within fifteen days, and send all reports by overnight courier or first-class mail with electronic copy.

requirements.description: For five years from service of this Order, notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any changes in Defendant's structure (dissolution, sale, merger, new subsidiary, name/address change, etc.) that may affect compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: A. For a period of five (5) years from the date of service ofthis Order, Defendant shall notify the Commission of any changes in structure of Defendant or any other business entity that Defendant directly or indirectly controls, or has an ownership interest in, that may affect Page 6 of 13 compliance obligations arising under this Order, including but not limited to incorporation or other organization; a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order; or a change in the business name or address, at least thirty (30) days prior to such change, provided that, with respect to any proposed change in the business entity about which Defendant learns less than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, Defendant shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.
requirements.deadline: 30 days prior to change (or as soon as practicable if less than 30 days notice)

requirements.description: 180 days after service of this Order and annually thereafter for three years, submit a written compliance report to the Commission, sworn under penalty of perjury, detailing manner and form of compliance
requirements.quoted_text: B. One hundred eighty (180) days after the date of service ofthis Order and annually thereafter for a period of three (3) years, Defendant shall provide a written report to the Commission, which is true and accurate and sworn to under penalty of perjury, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which it has complied and is complying with this Order.

requirements.description: For five years from service of this Order, notify the Commission of the filing of any bankruptcy petition within fifteen days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. For a period of five (5) years from the date of service of this Order, Defendant shall notify the Commission of the filing of a bankruptcy petition within fifteen (15) days of filing.

requirements.description: Send all required reports and notifications by overnight courier to the Commission's Associate Director, Division of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection; alternatively, may send by first-class mail if an electronic version is contemporaneously sent to DEBrief@ftc.gov
requirements.quoted_text: D. For purposes ofthis Order, Defendant shall, unless otherwise directed by the Commission's authorized representatives, send by overnight courier all reports and notifications required by this Order to the Commission, to the following address: Associate Director, Division of Enforcement Bureau of Consumer Protection Federal Trade Commission Washington, D.C. 20580 RE: FTC v. TALX, Inc. Provided that, in lieu of overnight courier, Defendant may send such reports or notifications by first-class mail, but only if the Defendant contemporaneously sends an electronic version of such reports or notifications to the Commission at: DEBrief@ftc.gov.

requirements.description: If undersigned counsel no longer represents Defendant, the Commission is authorized to communicate directly with the General Counsel of TALX
requirements.quoted_text: E. For purposes of the compliance reporting and monitoring required by this Order.if the undersigned counsel no longer represents Defendant, the Commission is authorized to communicate directly with the General Counsel of TALX. Provided, however, nothing in this provision shall limit the Commission's authority to pose as a consumer or supplier pursuant to Subsection B.2 of the section titled "Compliance Monitoring."

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For six years from entry of the Order, Defendant must create and retain records relating to FCRA notice compliance, training materials, and all documents demonstrating full compliance with the Order.

requirements.description: For six years from entry of this Order, retain files containing names, addresses, and telephone numbers of all users and furnishers who received the section 607(d) User Notice and Furnisher Notice, and all materials demonstrating compliance with section 607(d) of the FCRA
requirements.quoted_text: A. Files containing the names, addresses, telephone numbers, of all users and furnishers ofconsumer report information that received the section 607(d) User Notice and Furnisher Notice, and all materials considered by Defendant to demonstrate compliance with section 607(d) ofthe FCRA.

requirements.description: Retain copies of all training materials that relate to Defendant's activities as alleged in the Complaint and Defendant's compliance with this Order
requirements.quoted_text: B. Copies of all training materials that relate to Defendant's activities as alleged in the Complaint and Defendant's compliance with the provisions of this Order.

requirements.description: Retain all records and documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including copies of acknowledgments of receipt of the Order
requirements.quoted_text: C. All records and documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision ofthis Order, including but not limited to, copies of acknowledgments of receipt of this Order, required by the Sections titled "Distribution of Order" and "Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order."

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For three years from service of the Order, Defendant must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, relevant employees, and successor entities, and collect signed acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, and managers; all employees/agents/representatives engaged in conduct related to the Order's subject matter; and any business entity resulting from a structural change. Current personnel: within 10 days of service. New personnel: prior to assuming responsibilities. Successor entities: at least 10 days prior to the structural change.
requirements.quoted_text: A. Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to (l) all of its principals, officers, directors, and managers; (2) all of its employees, agents, and representatives who engage in conduct related to the subject matter of this Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Subsection A of the Section titled "Compliance Reporting." For current personnel, delivery shall be within ten (l0) days of service of this order upon Defendant. For new personnel, delivery shall occur prior to them assuming their responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Subsection A of the Section titled "Compliance Reporting," delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure.
requirements.deadline: 10 days for current personnel; prior to assuming responsibilities for new personnel

requirements.description: Secure a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order from all persons receiving a copy, within thirty days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: B. Defendant shall secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this Order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy ofthe Order pursuant to this Section.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days of its entry by the Court.

requirements.description: Within five business days of receipt of this Order as entered by the Court, submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant, within five (5) business days of receipt of this Order as entered by the Court, must submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: This Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter forpurposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement ofthis Order.

provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys' Fees
provisions.summary: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

requirements.description: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

duration.termination_text: For a period of five (5) years from the date of service of this Order [compliance reporting]; for a period of six (6) years from the date of entry of this Order [recordkeeping]; for a period of three (3) years from the date of service of this Order [distribution of order]. No single global termination clause is stated; the Order does not specify a unified expiration date.
